intro: Alsodeia socotrana, commonly known as Socotra's alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Socotra. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in arid or rocky environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in the flora of Socotra.
